body: {::highlight-answer} The standard VAT rate is 20% {:/highlight-answer} ##VAT rates for goods and services Rate | % of VAT | What the rate applies to - | - | - Standard | 20% | Most goods and services Reduced rate | 5% | Some goods and services, eg children's car seats and home energy Zero rate | 0% | Zero-rated goods and services, eg most food and children’s clothes The standard rate of VAT increased from 17.5 per cent to 20 per cent on 4 January 2011. Some things are exempt from VAT (eg postage stamps, financial and property transactions). HM Revenue & Customs lists the [rates of VAT](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/vat/forms-rates/rates/goods-services.htm "Rates of VAT on different goods and services"){:rel="external"} on different goods and services. *[VAT]: Value Added Tax
overview: Current VAT rates - standard 20% and rates for reduced rate and zero-rated items
